decks.notes: The deck is focused on quickly playing aggressive creatures and disruption spells to put pressure on the opponent and control the board. It utilizes cards like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Lightning Bolt to efficiently deal with threats while deploying threats like Murktide Regent, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Cori-Steel Cutter to quickly close out the game. The deck also includes cards like Daze, Wasteland, and Mishra's Bauble to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain tempo. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of aggression and control.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board with low-cost spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will while using cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent to pressure the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells like Daze and maintain card advantage with cards like Brazen Borrower and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Additionally, cards like Mishra's Bauble and Ponder help the player dig through their deck for key pieces while also providing information about the opponent's hand.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base and lock them out of casting spells while quickly ramping into powerful threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf. By utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void and Magus of the Moon to shut down nonbasic lands and low-cost spells, combined with fast mana sources like Chrome Mox and City of Traitors, this aggressive deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and finish the game quickly with cards like Sundering Eruption and The One Ring.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on using powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The deck also utilizes cards like Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's strategy and Eldrazi Temple to ramp up mana quickly. With a mix of efficient creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and control the board to secure a swift victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Eldrazi Temple, Eye of Ugin, and additional mana sources like Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Wasteland to control the opponent's resources. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient and large threats while disrupting their game plan, ultimately winning through aggressive creature combat and resource denial.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt opponent's strategies with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer, while quickly ramping up mana with Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Tomb to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and It That Heralds the End. The deck aims to control the game with disruptive spells and pressure opponents with aggressive Eldrazi creatures, ultimately overpowering them with high-impact threats and efficient mana usage.

The main focus of this deck is to combine the ability to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bring them back onto the battlefield using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. This combo strategy allows the player to put pressure on their opponent by suddenly bringing back large creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier or Archon of Cruelty. Additionally, the deck includes strong control elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes a mix of land disruption and card draw to maintain consistency and tempo.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, then use cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a devastating combo. Control elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize help protect the combo pieces, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help dig for key pieces. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Daze and Wasteland to slow down the opponent. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and Murktide Regent offers a powerful threat in the air.

The main focus of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Murktide Regent, backed up by efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Wasteland while maintaining card advantage with cards like Ponder and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck utilizes cantrips like Brainstorm and Mishra's Bauble to dig for key pieces and ensure smooth draws, allowing the player to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty, then using spells like Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Shallow Grave to bring them back onto the battlefield for a fast and explosive win. Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy help disrupt opponent's strategies while cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier provide additional value. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats early in the game, utilizing the combo potential of reanimation to gain a decisive advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back to the battlefield for a cheap cost. Cards like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier provide powerful threats that can swing the game in your favor. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and interaction with cards like Thoughtseize to protect your game plan. Overall, the deck aims to utilize the graveyard as a resource to quickly overwhelm your opponent with powerful creatures.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to maintain control of the game by disrupting your opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Nihil Spellbomb, while also maintaining card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also utilizes removal spells like Fatal Push and Flame of Anor to deal with threats on the board. Additionally, the deck includes powerful creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to pressure the opponent and close out the game. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's requirements and maximize efficiency.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play using spells like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. By utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection and countering opponent's spells with Force of Will and other counterspells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats early in the game. City of Traitors and other mana acceleration cards help to ramp up to casting these expensive creatures, while also providing backup in case the combo pieces are targeted.

The key concept of this combo deck is to utilize the synergy between Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's entire deck in one turn. The deck also includes cards like Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer to tutor for combo pieces, as well as disruption cards like Pyroblast and Ensnaring Bridge to buy time. Urza's Saga is used to tutor for key artifacts, while Karn, the Great Creator can shut down opposing artifacts. Blood Moon and Ancient Tomb provide additional disruption and mana acceleration, creating a powerful and versatile combo deck.

This Legacy Aggro-Delver deck focuses on using Delver of Secrets and efficient removal spells to control the game while applying pressure to the opponent. It also includes disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Stifle to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to tempo out opponents with a combination of threats and disruption, while also utilizing powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf. The deck's strategy is to establish board presence early on and maintain control throughout the game, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with its aggressive creatures and spells.

This UWx Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. Back to Basics is utilized to punish opponents relying heavily on non-basic lands, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and Thundertrap Trainer helps to lock down the opponent's creatures. The deck is designed to control the pace of the game, answer threats efficiently, and ultimately outvalue the opponent through card advantage and efficient removal.
